results.title: Radio romance
results.brief_description: Radio romance is an endearing work which creates warmth through the subtle use of multiple narratives and the affable assured performance of the band. Camera work and editing confidently exploit the rich setting with the songline expertly supported by the light-hearted use of props. Music performed by Strange Country.

results.title: Just business
results.brief_description:
A drama of revenge and retribution demonstrating high production values to create a corporate world of greed and indifference. Controlled camera work, lighting and slick editing combine with assured direction of the actors to create tension as this disturbing tale reaches its climax.
WARNING: THIS FILM CONTAINS SCENES THAT MAY DISTURB SOME VIEWERS

results.title: Love of static sound
results.brief_description: A range of visual treatments including image within image and beat mixed editing creates a seductive and culturally revealing music video clip. Two characters are depicted using a high impact visual style with an underlying narrative.

results.title: A Sporting life
results.creator_credit: Robin James, ABC-TV (Australia), Asian Studies Council and Griffith University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dragons tongue. - Series 2.”.
In this Chinese language program, Professor Colin Mackerras looks at popular sports and physical activities in China. Basketball is rising in popularity and China used its excellence in Ping Pong for diplomacy when it was re-opening its doors to the world. Physical education in schools is seen as very important, while Mao Tse-tung encouraged participation in the martial arts as a way of developing a physically, morally and spiritually sound country. The program also examines the different writing styles and the emphasis on balance and movement in forming characters.

results.title: Derick and Jonathan
results.brief_description: Set in a school, this delightful piece makes very effective use of setting and the familiarity of its audience to the trials and tribulations of two unlikely heroes in their ever-hopeful and competitive quest for love. The well-developed script and voice-over establishes an affectionate, playful tone complemented by the scenarios in which the lead characters find themselves.

results.title: Dragons tongue. - Series 2.
results.creator_credit: Robin James, ABC-TV (Australia), Asian Studies Council and Griffith University
results.brief_description: A series of lessons in the Chinese language intended for high school students using simple vocabulary and brief dramatisations utilising the vocabulary. Includes short sections about life in modern China and a segment on Chinese writing and calligraphy. Introduced by Colin McKerras.

results.title: Top Screen 2007
results.brief_description:
Top Screen showcases Victoria’s best moving image works created by VCE Media and VCE VET Multimedia students in 2006. Presented by ACMI, Top Screen is part of the VCE Season of Excellence 2007 managed by the Victorian Curriculum and Assessment Authority (VCAA) with support from ATOM.
This compilation contains 14 short films selected for the Top Screen VCE Season of Excellence 2007. One of the short films included in the compile is not licensed and therefore not available for screening: “Trunkfuls of love”
results.description:

results.title: Eating out
results.creator_credit: Robin James, ABC-TV (Australia) and Griffith University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dragons tongue. - Series 2.”.
The eating habits of the Chinese are illustrated through filmed and dramatised segments. We see different kinds of restaurants, factory canteens, and a Chinese family at home during mealtimes. The “History of Chinese” segment describes the different dialects and languages that exist in China emphasising that there is really only one written script for all of these. Vocabulary introduced covers day to day language concerned with mealtimes and shopping for food.

results.title: Urban scrawl
results.brief_description: This vibrant documentary leads its audience to a more sophisticated understanding of the controversial artistic subculture of street art. Well controlled production values allow the reasoned arguments of those involved to be developed in a manner that is both thought provoking and educative.

results.title: Siege
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan, Frank Donovan, Frederic Ullman, International Film Foundation and RKO Pathe Pictures
results.brief_description: Famous documentary by Julien Bryan on the invasion of Poland by the German army in September 1939 - the attack that began World War II. It captures, with powerful images, the terror and desperation of the refugees and the immense destruction in the cities and towns. Depicts the destructive effect on the lives of the people. An important work that shows how unprepared Poland was to face the German war machine. Depicts the first week of WWII, and includes quite graphic footage.
